cont.entity_a: Durability is poor, with holes appearing at the fingertips after light use. Stitching becomes loose after a few uses. Material quality has decreased over time, leading to faster wear.
cont.entity_b: Gloves ripped after second use and are not durable for unloading 1000+ boxes per week. Gloves rip at seams and fingertips when used with rough surfaces like concrete. Seams on fingers start to go after two weeks of light construction and tool maintenance.

cont.entity_a: Material at the fingertips is like spandex, contributing to wear.
The design has changed, resulting in a thicker glove that negates dexterity.
cont.entity_b: Palm and knuckle padding is effective in reducing calluses.

cont.entity_a: Stitching becomes loose after a few uses.
cont.entity_b: Stitching unravels and fingertips wear quickly with labor work.

cont.entity_a: Price remains the same despite a drop in quality.
Touchscreen performance is excellent initially but degrades in dirty environments. Touchscreen capability is a luxury and not always practical for extended typing.
Fit is comfortable and true to size, providing excellent dexterity.
cont.entity_b: Size is smaller than expected, requiring a size up for a proper fit.

cont.entity_a: The gloves offer good protection for light to moderate tasks but are not durable for heavy-duty work.
Machine washable and retains quality after multiple washes.
cont.entity_b: Comfortable and breathable but not suitable for cold weather.

cont.entity_a: Fit is comfortable and true to size, providing excellent dexterity.
cont.entity_b: Dexterity is good for tasks like yard work and light construction.
